product1.name: Champagne Brut
product1.subtitle: Simplicity
product1.description: With a fine blend of Pinot Meunier, Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this champagne is accessible in its flavors, and astonishing in its infinite possibilities for pairing. It is made from reserve wines, giving it a unique consistency over the years. Its fruitiness will never disappoint your aperitifs, meats or fish. Enjoy it chilled by the pool or by the fire, it's synonymous with carefree celebration! It's also available in half-bottle format for solo pleasures, and in Magnum or Jeroboam for those who think big!

product2.name: Champagne Rosé
product2.subtitle: Sweetness for everyone
product2.description: The blend is made with reserve wine add by Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay. A full-bodied, salmon-colored color. On the nose, notes of figs, red plums and wild strawberries lead the palate to become more lively, with balanced fluidity and hints of confectionery. Despite its sweetness, it's a wine everyone can enjoy. It goes just as well with your most sophisticated desserts as with a simple chocolate fondant, to finish your lunches and dinners in the most beautiful way.

product3.name: Champagne Cuvée réserve
product3.subtitle: Perfect balanced
product3.description: It will surprise you with the elegance of its bubbles and its voluptuous tone. The nose reveals brioche, followed by subtle citrus, lime and verbena aromas. Taste finesse begins with a pastry-like aroma of raisin bread, followed by notes of pomegranate and mirabelle plum. Composed of Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay, it brings out the more than 10 million bubbles in a bottle of champagne with unrivalled vigor. This champagne is the perfect balance between elegance and festivity, and punctuates your summer evenings in the most beautiful way.

product4.name: Champagne Cuvée Eveillescence
product4.subtitle: Le champagne des fins gourmets
product4.description: Made from 100% Pinot Meunier, this is the champagne for great Champagne lovers. With it, you'll truly feel the limestone soil and mineral hues brought to our vines by the sun. This single-varietal Champagne has a unique taste and subtlety, with notes of Viennese pastries such as frangipane, and fruits such as apricot and nectarine. On the palate, the spices harmonize and balance each other, adding depth. Designed and conceived as a family affair, it's made to stand on its own, but will blend perfectly with your most refined dishes.

product5.name: Ratafia
product5.subtitle: A unique taste experience
product5.description: Discover the exquisite flavor of ratafia. Our ratafia, crafted with passion and expertise, offers a unique taste experience that will awaken your senses. This delightful aperitif unveils a perfect balance between the sweetness of fruits and the subtle warmth of alcohol. The enchanting aromas of nuts, dried fruits, and spices create a harmonious symphony that will tantalize your palate with every sip. This bottle of ratafia embodies the art of mixology, ready to be enjoyed on its own as an aperitif or incorporated into sophisticated cocktails. Its complex flavor profile makes it an ideal choice to accompany fine cheeses, dried fruits, or simply to celebrate special moments in life. Each bottle is the result of old tradition, combining artisanal expertise and superior quality ingredients. Treat yourself or your loved ones to this gustatory treasure and let yourself be carried away by the elegance and refinement of ratafia. This bottle embodies the essence of conviviality and sophistication.

history.title: Who we are
history.intro: Winemaker landlord, cooperative grower for 3 generations, we bring all our attention to the plots from many transmissions dating back to known origins since 1670. Some of these lands happened to be suitable for the cultivation of the vine by their sub-soils with a tendency to limestone and sandy-limestone, their south-east facing slopes and their beautiful sunshine. These 3 elements combine to give the wines a quality development with a touch of freshness. Following the use of rootstocks to ward off phylloxera, vines were replanted in the family as early as 1956. Each year, while care begins with winter pruning, it only ends with the hand-picking of the grapes. That's why Xavier likes to say to his 3 children, Clémence, Héloïse and Pierre-Baptiste: 'The plant speaks to us'. Attentive to the environment in which we have been evolving for many years, we recuperate rainwater, work the soil and grass our vines. In this way, we try to limit inputs as much as possible and reduce Co2 emissions on our own scale. The estate is certified VDC: Viticulture Durable en Champagne.
